data.title: Amazon reportedly lets toys go on sale without proof of safety
data.text: The online retail giant is reportedly asking for safety docs only after some toys are already listed online.

data.title: Why Markets Think Tariffs Will Help Apple and Hurt Amazon
data.text: Tariff talks have hits Amazon hard as other retailers outperform. Is Apple dependent on China, or is it the other way around?

data.title: In lawsuit, Amazon takes on ‘unlawful advertising scheme’ that mimics its branding and trademarks
data.text: Amazon alleges in a new lawsuit that a group of unnamed individuals used the tech giant’s name, trademarks and branding to dupe people into clicking on links with the promise of fraudulent Amazon gift cards and other rewards that would never come.

data.title: Amazon's Newest Prime Market Is the Country with the Amazon Running Through It
data.text: Brazilians can sign up for Amazon Prime and its various benefits, including 2-day shipping, beginning this week.

data.title: FTC Amazon merchant interviews show robust investigation: Antitrust pro
data.text: The Federal Trade Commission is cracking down on potential antitrust among Big Tech, including Amazon. CNBC's "Power Lunch" team is joined by Kevin Arquit, co-chair of the Antitrust Group at Kasowitz Benson Torres and former director of the FTC's Bureau of Competition .

data.title: Here's Proof That Amazon Is Concerned About Roku
data.text: The e-commerce juggernaut just made a big move in an attempt to slow the streaming pioneer's soaring growth.

data.title: Micron, Amazon Zscaler & GE in the Trader Blitz
data.text: The "Halftime Report" traders take investors through some of the day's biggest movers.

data.title: FTC ramping up investigation into Amazon: report
data.text: FBN's Hillary Vaughn on the FTC ramping up its investigation into Amazon.

data.title: Amazon allows some toys to go on sale before asking for proof of safety compliance
data.text: Some Amazon third-party sellers are only asked to submit safety documents weeks after they start selling, leaving Amazon's marketplace open to a flood of potentially unsafe products, CNBC has learned.

data.title: 7 Strong-Buy Stocks Hedge Funds Are Buying Now
data.text: These strong-buy stocks are not just top hedge fund picks -- they also boast the Street’s seal of approval, as reflected by overall analyst ratings.

data.title: It just got very hard for Amazon's online pharmacy to access patient medication data
data.text: Surescripts manages about 80% of electronic prescriptions in the United States, and it's canceled a deal that Amazon's PillPack needed for patient data.

data.title: LATAM Streaming Space Heats Up With Amazon Prime in Brazil
data.text: Amazon (AMZN), Netflix, Apple and Spotify are making every effort to capitalize on LATAM streaming space.

data.title: FTC investigation into Amazon reportedly gearing up
data.text: The probe is part of a broader antitrust look into big tech by Congress, regulators and attorneys general.

data.title: Amazon, Home Depot Sign On As Tenants To Multi-Story Seattle Warehouse
data.text: "If you build it, they will come." They prophesy has come true as a multi-story warehouse building built in Seattle by commercial real-estate giant Prologis (NYSE: PLD) has its first tenants: Amazon and Home Depot.

data.title: Amazon Faces Probe by U.S. Antitrust Officials Over Marketplace
data.text: Federal Trade Commission investigators have begun interviewing small businesses that sell products on Amazon.com Inc. to see how to company’s market power impacts competition. Bloomberg Opinion columnist Alex Webb has the details on "Bloomberg Surveillance." His opinions are his own.

data.title: FTC probing Amazon over marketplace: report
data.text: Federal Trade Commission investigators have been interviewing small businesses that sell products on Amazon.com Inc.
